humanMachineDialogue.author: Memory Reasoning
humanMachineDialogue.text: The report indicates that the tumor classification is pT2NOLOVORO. This means that there are no positive lymph nodes (pN0) based on the rules provided. The 'O' in the tumor classification indicates that there were no observed lymph nodes (OL), and the 'V' indicates that there were no clinical lymph nodes (V0). Therefore, the N stage for this patient is N0, as all assessed lymph nodes are negative for metastatic carcinoma.

humanMachineDialogue.author: ZS Reasoning
humanMachineDialogue.text: The 'pT2' in the tumor classification indicates that the tumor has a size of 2-5 cm and has not invaded the chest wall or skin. The 'N' in the tumor classification is 'N0', which means that there is no regional lymph node metastasis.
